page.title: 17LIMESTONE IN WALSALL
page.content: In the 18th century Walsall had six blast furnaces. These furnaces were used for smelting iron.{Limestone}was used in these furnaces, one of these furnaces was at Ladypool, Rushall. In 1978 some of the mines started to collapse and houses became affected. The Government brought in some consultant engineers to{investigate {the extent of damage}and the risk of ground movements. No records or maps were kept so it was almost impossible to find the{Limestone mines.}To find the mines the engineers drilled holes in the ground. Not all of the mines have been discovered. The engineers can not forecast whether there will be any more disturbances. There is a very low risk of damage to houses. Now people find it{very hard to sell {houses}because of limestone.
